item.title: A VS Code Fork for Writing
item.description:
The seed

It was my friend Frido who planted the seeds of this idea into my brain, by showing me a ‘brainrot IDE’ which had been accepted into YCombinator’s Fall 2025 batch. I tried it out and discovered that, like many other AI-enabled IDEs, it was a forked version of Visual Studio Code a.k.a. VS Code. The only difference was that it was an indirect fork. Its ‘parent’ source code came from an open-source AI-enabled IDE called Void. VS Code was technically the ‘grandpa’.
